RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $57,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAPITS CHOICE stalked the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, shifted four wide leaving the turn and closed willingly to be up in the closing strides. WICKED NIGHT away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane, and just failed to last. LICORICE away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of WICKED NIGHT entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival through the final turn and into the stretch, and gave way grudgingly late. CAIRO CRUSADER broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch at the back of a compact field, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive but was unable to mount a serious late bid. ROAD CLOSURE was off a step slow, but rushed up three wide through the first turn to force the pace three wide entering the backstretch, continued to chase the leaders three wide to the final turn, before weakening.

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Night
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Tapits Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 4 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Crusader
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Road Closure
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, pressed 3 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 11 Allowed 4 lb s. Claiming Price $5,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS THE HYPE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backside, opened a clear advantage approaching the final turn, and widened her margin late under confident handling. TEXAS HUMOR broke sharply and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, pressed the leader through the stretch the first time, held a tracking trip one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, was unable to keep tabs on the pacesetter entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. PERFECT PENNY away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. SILVER ARROW unhurried early while trailing the field into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, rallied three wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. ISLAND LIVING tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backside, continued to save ground into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Ra ce Since April 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AVE'S IN COMMAND away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, held a clear advantage into the final turn, and continued to widen her margin through the lane while being kept to task and drifting out under left handed urging. PADDY D'ORO away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn and closed two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. GORKY PARK broke sharply and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished from along the inside in the drive. MCMURPHY tracked the leader into the stretch the first time while racing between rivals, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER steadied sharply when put in tight quarters at the rail leaving the first turn, and trailed the field throughout. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul, as well as a stewards inquiry into a incident entering leaving the first turn. The rider of VANCOUVER'S HUNTER lodged a claim of foul against the riders of both PADDY D'ORO and MCMURPHY. After review the stewards disqualified PADDY D'ORO from second and placed this horse fifth for causing interference to VANCOUVER'S HUNTER leaving the first turn.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: McMurphy
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early, trailed, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Ave's in Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied 2 wide, widened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race S ince April 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PINEAPPLE TIDBITS tracked the leaders into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, battled for the lead from along the rail midway down the backstretch, rallied along the inside through the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and held WALKINTHEWALK safely at bay late to prove best. WALKINTHEWALK unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed with a rush from along the rail in the drive to get up for the place in deep stretch. BAKFIRE BABY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. ANOTHERSUNNYDAY broke sharply and battled for the lead two wide from between rivals in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive. ARIKARA away alertly and raced to the lead from along the inside entering the first turn, drifted into the three path and continued to battled for the lead in the run down the backside and through the final turn, but was outfinished late while finishing six wide in the drive. STORM CRUISER settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, trailed the field in the run down the backside, and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Arikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.OWNER: Musgrove Donald H Spencer Stewart and Johnson Lyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, vied inside, rallied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Cruiser
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Walkinthewalk
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Bakfire Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Anothersunnyday
ENTRY.OWNER: Leffler Bob Killins Bryan and McCormick Gord
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, chased 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NINE OCLOCK CEASER away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, opened a clear advantage approaching the final turn, and widened her margin over the final furlong while under confident handling. TEXAS LEGACY broke sharply, but was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing three wide into the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished willingly four wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. LENT ME TWENTY away alertly and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but was needed more when called upon while finishing evenly for a share. STOLO SPIRIT unhurried early while dropping back to trailed, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. SWEET AS HONEY tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but began to weaken midway through the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Stolo Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lent Me Twenty
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Nine Oclock Ceaser
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, clear lead, widened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $6,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUEEN OF ATTITUDE stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, advanced from along the inside midway down the backside to gain a tracking trip entering the final turn, raced just out from the rail through the turn, shifted two wide in mid stretch and was up in time to run down a game LASTING LIGHT to prove best. LASTING LIGHT away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, and just failed to last. ICE BREAKER away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of LASTING LIGHT in the run down the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. ARTISTIC JEWLER stalked the early pace from the back of a compact field entering the backstretch, launched her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest four wide in the drive. LIZZIES GIRL broke sharply and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. KICK UP THE DUST tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Kick Up the Dust
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, led, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, advanced 3/8, rallied 2w, closed 2w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Artistic Jewler
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied rail, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROLLIE'S SPIRIT vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace from the inside of REMEMBERTHEALAMO in the run down the backside and through the final turn, got the better of his ace rival entering the lane, and drew clear late. SILARONE away alertly, but was allowed to settled at the back of the pack entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to get up for the place late. ATOMIC HAZE away well and settled off the contested early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished with interest four wide in the drive to garner a share. EH TEE EM broke sharply and stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn and finished from along the rail in the drive. REMEMBERTHEALAMO broke outwards brushing the gate at the start, but rushed up to duel for the lead two wide entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, but faded in the stretch drive. CHAMPIOSA settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Champiosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Rollie's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Atomic Haze
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outwards, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Silarone
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,
